D4.2 SEALS Metadata
D5.2
D5.4-2.1-FR
Repository Metadata (from the SEALS wiki)

(Inserted here since that wiki is restricted)
This page applies to version 1.1 (as of 28.04.2010) of the repository services.
This page describes how to use the SEALS Metadata to describe entities, that are to be stored in the Test Data Repository Service (TDRS), Tools Repository Service (TRS) or Results Repository Service (RRS). In order to distinguish between the
suite metadata
, we further use the terms
repository metadata
to refer to the metadata describing these entities.
In the following examples we will assume that the repositories services are accessable under the following URLs:
Test Data Repository Service:
http://seals-test.sti2.at/tdrs-web/
Tools Repository Service:
http://seals-test.sti2.at/trs-web/
Results Repository Service:
http://seals-test.sti2.at/rrs-web/
SEALS Metadata

The SEALS metadata defines the data model used in all the systems developed in the SEALS project (i.e., the SEALS Portal and the SEALS Platform) as well as in any other system that requires interacting with them. It is defined in deliverable D4.2 and is available as an OWL ontology at
http://www.seals-project.eu/ontologies/SEALSMetadata.owl
. Consequently, as the aforementioned repositories are part of the SEALS platform, the repository metadata is based on the vocabulary defined by the SEALS Metadata ontology.
Constraints

Optional definition of dc:identifier:
If a dc:identifierattribute is given in the metadata of an entity, the repository service will use the value of this statement as an identifier of the entity. Therefore, it needs to be unique within the repository in which the entity will be stored, otherwise the registration of the entity will fail. This identifier will then be used to create a subject for the metadata, which will also be the dereferenceable URI of the entity.
dc:identifier is auto-generated:
If the metadata of an entity lacks the definition of a dc:identifier attribute, the identifier will be automatically generated in the form of a universally unique identifier (UUID) and will be visible in the metadata returned by the repository after the successful registration of the entity. This identifier will then be used to create a subject for the metadata, which will also be the dereferenceable URI of the entity.
Blank node as subject:
A blank node must be used as subject in the metadata of the entity. All statements in the metadata having this blank node as subject will then be updated to use as subject the new dereferenceable URI of the form
http://seals-test.sti2.at/.../
<identifier>/
. In the case of a persistent test data collection which has the dc:identifier
Conformance Benchmark Suite
, this URI will look like
http://seals.sti2.at/tdrs-web/testdata/persistent/Conforname+Benchmark+Suite/
. For a persistent test data version having the dc:identifier
cbs-1.0
, which is added to the aforementioned collection, this URI will look like
http://seals.sti2.at/tdrs-web/testdata/persistent/Conforname+Benchmark+Suite/cbs-1.0/
Single blank node for statements:
Only a single blank node should be used for the statements in the metadata, which represents the single entity described by the metadata.
Artifacts must have a seals:hasName property:
An artifact (e.g., test data collection, tool or interpretation) needs to have a seals:hasName attribute defining its human readable name. This name does not have to be unique.
Artifact versions must have a seals:hasVersion number property:
An artifact version (e.g., test data version or tool version) needs to have a seals:hasVersionNumber defining its humand readable version number. This version number does not have to be unique.
Any other properties can be added to the metadata, regardless if an ontology defining these exists or not.
Examples

In the following we give for each type of entity a (minimalistic) metadata example.
Persistent Test Data Collection

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<rdf:RDF
        xmlns:rdfs="
http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#
"
        xmlns:rdf="
http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#
"
        xmlns:seals="
http://www.seals-project.eu/ontologies/SEALSMetadata.owl#
"
        xmlns:dcterms="
http://purl.org/dc/terms/
">
    <seals:PersistentTestData>
        <seals:hasName rdf:datatype="
http://www.w3.org/XMLSchema#string
">Conference Testsuite</seals:hasName>
        <dcterms:description rdf:datatype="
http://www.w3.org/XMLSchema#string
">The conference dataset</dcterms:description>
    </seals:PersistentTestData>
</rdf:RDF>
If registered in the TDRS, the service will return something like the following:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<rdf:RDF
        xmlns:rdfs="
http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#
"
        xmlns:rdf="
http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#
"
        xmlns:seals="
http://www.seals-project.eu/ontologies/SEALSMetadata.owl#
"
        xmlns:dcterms="
http://purl.org/dc/terms/
">
    <seals:PersistentTestData rdf:about="
http://seals.sti2.at/tdrs-web/testdata/persistent/afe1ecf7-a7e9-45f7-beb6-19e109c4761f/
">
        <seals:hasName rdf:datatype="
http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string
">Conference Testsuite</seals:hasName>
        <dcterms:description rdf:datatype="
http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#string
">The conference dataset</dcterms:description>
        <dcterms:identifier rdf:datatype="
http://www.w3.org/XMLSchema#string
">afe1ecf7-a7e9-45f7-beb6-19e109c4761f</dcterms:identifier>
        <dcterms:created rdf:datatype="
http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#dateTime
">2010-12-20T16:42:14.518+01:00</dcterms:created>
    </seals:PersistentTestData>
</rdf:RDF>
Persistent Test Data Version

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<rdf:RDF xmlns:rdf="
http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#
"
        xmlns:seals="
http://www.seals-project.eu/ontologies/SEALSMetadata.owl#
"
        xmlns:dcterms="
http://purl.org/dc/terms/
">
    <seals:TestDataVersion>
        <seals:hasVersionNumber rdf:datatype="
http://www.w3.org/XMLSchema#string
">2010</seals:hasVersionNumber>
        <dcterms:description rdf:datatype="
http://www.w3.org/XMLSchema#string
">Version 2010 of the Conference Testsuite</dcterms:description>
    </seals:TestDataVersion>
</rdf:RDF>
Usage Example
